metadata.Name: Multilingual Hate Speech Data
metadata.Description: A multilingual dataset of tweets in English and Arabic annotated for hate speech. The data was collected from Twitter using hate-related keywords and manually annotated. It contains approximately 15k English tweets and 5k Arabic tweets.
metadata.Paper Title: Deep Learning Models for Multilingual Hate Speech Detection
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the 3rd Workshop on Abusive Language Online (ALW3)
Affiliations: Human Language Technology Center of Excellence
metadata.Abstract: The task of hate speech detection has been mostly addressed for English. In this paper, we focus on the problem of multilingual hate speech detection. We introduce a new dataset of tweets in English and Arabic for this task. We experiment with a number of deep learning models with and without multilingual embeddings. We show that it is possible to build a classifier that can process text from more than one language. We also show that a multilingual model can be used in a zero-shot setting, where it is tested on a language that was not seen during training. Our results show that a multilingual model can be a good starting point for a low-resource language, and that its performance can be improved with a small amount of in-language data.
